alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:07PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worcester, central Hampshire and southeastern Franklin Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 106 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Amherst, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amherst, Northampton, Orange, South Hadley, Belchertown, Athol, Templeton, Granby, Barre, Hadley, Hubbardston, Sunderland, Hatfield, Hardwick, Leverett, Shutesbury, Phillipston, Whately, Pelham and Royalston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western and central Massachusetts.
